p: In the current study, 15 bacterial endophytes were obtained from the surface-sterilized healthy leaves of the medicinal plant P. incisa. These bacteria are related to two major phyla, proteobacteria represented by 33.3% of the total isolates and firmicutes, represented by 66.6%. In the same regard, Costa et al. [ 24] showed that the endophytic strains obtained from leaves of Phaseolus vulgaris belonged to proteobacteria, firmicutes, and actinobacteria with a percentage of 36.7%, 32.9%, and 29.7% of the total bacterial isolates, respectively.
